intro: Mapania sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran mapania, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Sumatra in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its woody stem, opposite leaves, and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland and mountainous forest areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
